targets.query:
from(bucket: "Test/autogen")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "synology_SMART_status2")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["nas_name"] == "Server2")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "disk_serial" or r["_field"] == "disk_model" or r["_field"] == "disk_status")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["disk_path"] == "/dev/sata1")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["smart_attribute"] == "Current_Pending_Sector")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
|> last()
  |> limit(n: 1)
 |> pivot(rowKey: ["_time"], columnKey: ["_field"], valueColumn: "_value")
 |> group(columns: ["_time"], mode:"by")
 |> map(
    fn: (r) => ({
        r with
            //////////////////////////
            //Disk_Status value mapping
            //////////////////////////
            disk_status_converted: if r.disk_status == 1 then
                "Passed"
            else if r.disk_status == 2 then
                "Failed"    
            else
                "ERROR!!!!",
        }),
    )
  |> drop(columns: ["_measurement", "_stop", "_start", "_time", "nas_name", "disk_path", "smart_attribute","disk_status"])
  |> rename(columns: {disk_model: "Model", disk_serial: "Serial", disk_status_converted: "Status"})
  |> yield()

panels.description: Count of reallocated sectors. When the hard drive finds a read/write/verification error, it marks that sector as "reallocated" and transfers data to a special reserved area (spare area). This process is also known as remapping, and reallocated sectors are called "remaps". The raw value normally represents a count of the bad sectors that have been found and remapped. Thus, the higher the attribute value, the more sectors the drive has had to reallocate. This allows a drive with bad sectors to continue operation; however, a drive which has had any reallocations at all is significantly more likely to fail in the near future.[3] While primarily used as a metric of the life expectancy of the drive, this number also affects performance. As the count of reallocated sectors increases, the read/write speed tends to become worse because the drive head is forced to seek to the reserved area whenever a remap is accessed. If sequential access speed is critical, the remapped sectors can be manually marked as bad blocks in the file system in order to prevent their use.

panels.title: Spin Up Time

panels.description:
parameter indicates a count of hard disk spindle start/stop cycles.

Each hard disk has its own limited number of these cycles depending on manufacturer. The maximum number of spinups/spindowns is called a threshold. When the parameter’s value drops down to the threshold, it means a hard disk is unhealthy.
